intro: Oreocharis wangwentsaii var. emeiensis, commonly known as the Emei Mountain oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
